au.edu.rmit.cpt222.model.interfaces

Interface GameEngineCallback


  • public interface GameEngineCallback
    Assignment interface for SADI to notify client of GameEngine events.
    Author:
    Mikhail Perepletchikov and Caspar Ryan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void coinFlip(Coin.Face coinFace, GameEngine engine)
      Called as the coin is "rotating" after a flip.
      void coinFlipOutcome(int coinNumber, Coin.Face coinFace, GameEngine engine)
      Called when the coin stopped "rotating".
      void gameResult(Player player, GameEngine.GameStatus result, GameEngine engine)
      Called for each Player to indicate the outcome of the current game.

    • Method Detail

      • coinFlip

        void coinFlip(Coin.Face coinFace,
              GameEngine engine)
        Called as the coin is "rotating" after a flip. Use this to update your GUI display for each coin flip or log to console.
        Parameters:
        coinFace - the current (upfacing) face of the "rotating" coin
        engine - a convenience reference to the engine so the receiver can call methods if necessary
        See Also:
        GameEngine

      • coinFlipOutcome

        void coinFlipOutcome(int coinNumber,
                     Coin.Face coinFace,
                     GameEngine engine)
        Called when the coin stopped "rotating". Use this to update your GUI display for each coin flip or log to console.
        Parameters:
        coinNumber - the number of this coin in the coin "series"
        coinFace - the final coin face resulted from a "flip"
        engine - a convenience reference to the engine so the receiver can call methods if necessary
        See Also:
        GameEngine

      • gameResult

        void gameResult(Player player,
                GameEngine.GameStatus result,
                GameEngine engine)
        Called for each Player to indicate the outcome of the current game. Use this to update your GUI display or log to console.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player who is playing the game
        result - indicates game outcome - won/lost/drew
        engine - a convenience reference to the engine so the receiver can call methods if necessary
        See Also:
        GameEngine
